title: Test MODPATH-5 - Particle Tracking Analysis Demonstration
description: Demonstrates MODPATH-5 particle tracking capabilities including PathlineFile and EndpointFile utilities for 64-particle analysis, visualization, and transport studies

packages.purpose: Reading and analyzing MODPATH-5 particle trajectory data
Reading and analyzing MODPATH-5 particle endpoint data
Visualization of pathlines and endpoints with model grid
Grid discretization for particle tracking domain
Basic package with gradient boundary conditions
Heterogeneous hydraulic properties for flow patterns
Multi-well pumping system for particle capture
Output control for head and budget files

package_details.PathlineFile: Utility for reading MODPATH-5 particle trajectory files
package_details.EndpointFile: Utility for reading MODPATH-5 particle endpoint files
package_details.PlotMapView: Visualization tool for pathlines and model grid display
package_details.DIS: Single-layer discretization for particle tracking analysis
package_details.BAS: Boundary conditions with head gradient for flow direction
package_details.LPF: Heterogeneous hydraulic conductivity with high/low zones
package_details.WEL: Three-well system for capture zone delineation

key_features: MODPATH-5 particle tracking file utilities and analysis
PathlineFile class for trajectory data reading and processing
EndpointFile class for final location analysis
Multi-well capture zone analysis and visualization
Heterogeneous aquifer system with flow barriers and channels
Color-coded particle visualization and pathline plotting
Professional particle tracking applications and workflows
learning_objectives: Understanding MODPATH-5 file formats and data structures
Mastering PathlineFile and EndpointFile utility methods
Implementing multi-particle analysis and statistical evaluation
Developing particle tracking visualization and presentation skills
Applying heterogeneous aquifer concepts to particle transport
Understanding well capture zone analysis and delineation
Learning professional applications of particle tracking
Comparing MODPATH version capabilities and evolution
